description: From Middle English upshiften, upschyften (“to raise”), equivalent to up- +‎ shift.

entries.meaning: (automotive, cycling) A shift to a higher gear
A shift to a higher level, such as of frequency, growth, economic level, etc.

verbs.description: upshift (third-person singular simple present upshifts, present participle upshifting, simple past and past participle upshifted)

entries.meaning: (automotive, cycling) To shift to a higher gear
examples: You can upshift to second gear once the car is moving.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To shift to a higher level, such as of frequency, growth rate, economic level, etc.
examples: The frequency of the light is upshifted.
